channel.title: Ivan Cronyn
channel.description: Essays on AI deployment, engineering leadership, and financial technology.

item.title: Compromised Witnesses
item.description: Self-reported developer productivity with AI tools is structurally unreliable. The witnesses are compromised by the same cognitive biases Cialdini mapped decades ago.

item.title: Observable, reversible, enforceable: three requirements for AI in production
item.description: Three requirements for AI in production. Before asking whether AI can do something, ask whether your system can absorb the mistakes.

item.title: The Suspicion Tax
item.description: What AI content actually costs - and why trust, not filtering, is the design problem.

item.title: Bainbridge's Ironies of Automation, forty years on
item.description: Lisanne Bainbridge's 1983 paper on the ironies of automation maps precisely onto how we're integrating AI into modern software systems.

item.title: Trust, not capability: the real bottleneck in AI-assisted engineering
item.description: The models are good enough. The bottleneck is trust - and trust is built from infrastructure, not adoption speed.

item.title: Building engineers in the age of AI
item.description: AI changes what junior work looks like. If we're not careful, we'll optimise for today's velocity and break tomorrow's capability.
